attribution: Created for the Rutherford School Physics Project by PS.
title: Force on table legs

children.value:
A table consists of a circular wooden board of mass 
$m = 3$
 kg resting on top of three vertical legs, each of mass 
$M = 0.5$
 kg. The legs are equidistant from the centre of the table and form an equilateral triangle. Use 
$g = 9.8$
 m s
$^{-2}$
.
Find the magnitude of the reaction force from one of the legs on the tabletop.

answer.value:
The magnitude of the reaction force from the ground on one of the legs is equal to 
$\valuedef{N}{14.7}{N}$
.

children.value: Find the magnitude of the reaction force from the ground on one of the legs.
